title: Convert homepage hero into scrollable multi-banner slider

requirements.summary: Replace the static HeroSection message with a swipe/drag-enabled hero slider/carousel while keeping the full-viewport hero layout and fixed TopNav behavior intact.
acceptanceCriteria: On route '/' the top section renders as a slider/carousel instead of a single static hero message.
Users can change slides on mobile via horizontal swipe/drag.
Users can change slides on desktop via visible navigation controls (e.g., arrows and/or dots).
The hero section retains its existing full-viewport feel (min-h-screen) and does not break the fixed TopNav behavior.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable hero slider component implementing slide state, drag/swipe gestures (touch + pointer), and desktop navigation controls (prev/next + indicators) without adding new dependencies.

Refactor HeroSection to render the new HeroSlider inside the existing full-viewport section wrapper, preserving current background visuals, spacing (including pt-20), and min-h-screen layout so TopNav remains unaffected.

requirements.summary: Populate the hero slider with the 4 provided banner slides, each with the exact Headline, Subheadline, Supporting Line, and CTA button text, maintaining the existing HeroSection typographic style.
acceptanceCriteria: The slider contains 4 slides (the 3 primary banners plus the optional 4th banner).
Each slide displays its Headline, Subheadline, Supporting Line, and CTA(s) as provided, without reusing the same overall message across slides.
Typography and spacing remain consistent with the existing HeroSection style (centered layout, large headline, readable subhead/supporting lines).

file_operations.description: Implement the slide content data (4 slides) with the provided English copy and CTA labels exactly as given; render each slide with HeroSection-consistent centered layout, headline/subheadline/supporting line hierarchy, and 1–2 CTA buttons per slide.

requirements.summary: Wire hero slider CTA buttons to existing strategy call behavior, framework section scrolling, and client-side route navigation (pushState + popstate) with scroll-to-top on route changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking any "Book…"/"Schedule…" CTA opens the configured strategy call flow (calendar if configured, otherwise mailto).
Clicking "Explore the CONTROL™ Framework" smoothly scrolls to the element with id="framework" on the homepage (accounting for header offset as current HeroSection does).
Clicking "Start Your Transformation" navigates to /process and scrolls to top.
Clicking "See How We Work" navigates to /process and scrolls to top.
Clicking "Request Founder Blueprint™" navigates to /contact and scrolls to top.
Clicking "Evaluate Your Systems" navigates to /contact and scrolls to top.

file_operations.description: Connect CTA actions to existing behaviors: use bookStrategyCall for all "Book…"/"Schedule…" CTAs, reuse the existing HeroSection-style scroll-to-framework behavior for "Explore the CONTROL™ Framework" (with header offset), and implement internal navigation using window.history.pushState + PopStateEvent('popstate') for /process and /contact plus scroll-to-top (respecting reduced-motion for scroll behavior).

requirements.summary: Add accessibility and motion-safe behavior to the hero slider: keyboard navigation, ARIA labeling, visible focus states, and prefers-reduced-motion support for transitions/autoplay.
acceptanceCriteria: Slider navigation controls are reachable and operable via keyboard.
Controls have appropriate accessible names (e.g., aria-label for previous/next and slide indicators).
When prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, slide transitions avoid motion-heavy animations and any autoplay behavior is disabled (if autoplay exists).

file_operations.description: Create a small hook that detects prefers-reduced-motion via matchMedia and updates on changes, to be used by the hero slider for motion-safe behavior.

Add a11y and motion-safe behavior: enable left/right keyboard navigation (when the slider region is focused), add ARIA attributes (e.g., aria-roledescription="carousel", aria-labels for prev/next and indicators), ensure controls have visible focus styles (focus-visible ring/outline), and conditionally reduce/disable animated transitions (and ensure no autoplay when reduced motion is preferred).
